data.text: @Reuters Common sense. Did the media miss the release of all the serious side effects associated with the COVID-19 shot?   The one they called a "vaccination" that prevented 96% of COVID cases and was "completely safe"?  Media ought to be civilly liable for their "vaccine" disinformation.

@Reuters In Sweden the same recommendation was made. 
https://t.co/azEwDYbRpo
@Reuters Florida breaks with science...could be the slogan for Death Santi's🤔

@Reuters what kind of health mentality is that?
i let my 6yo daughter get the pfizer jab even if she is in top condition. no one knows how she may acquire the covid, i will not take that chance that she is not forever unprotected.
@Reuters The medical licensing board should take away Lapaduo’s (sp) medical license since he is peddling info that will get people killed.

@HattieA12837562 @Reuters They’re not taking about a mandate. Simply the FL SG is saying don’t bother, healthy kids don’t need it. This article is saying that despite CDC recommending kids > 5 get the vaccine, FL will not recommend it for healthy kids. the hope is kids catch covid for natural immunity.
@Reuters This isn’t going to end well.
@Reuters Give them what they want, full autonomy, by removal from the United States.
